cards.front: What are Newton's laws of motion?
cards.back: First law (Law of Inertia): An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force. Second law (F=ma): The acceleration of an object as produced by a net force is directly proportional to the magnitude of the net force, in the same direction as the net force, and inversely proportional to the mass of the object. Third law (Action-Reaction): For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.stem: Which of the following statements correctly describes Newton's second law of motion?
options: The force acting on an object is directly proportional to its acceleration.
An object at rest tends to stay at rest unless acted upon by a force.
A body will move in a straight line with constant velocity unless acted upon by a net force.
questions.rationale: Newton's second law (F = ma) states that the force acting on an object is directly proportional to its acceleration.

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's first law states that an object at rest will stay at rest, and an object in motion will stay in motion, unless acted upon by a net external force. Newton's second law relates to the acceleration of an object due to a force, and is commonly expressed as F = ma (Force equals mass times acceleration). Newton's third law states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

insights.title: Machine Learning Basics Insight
insights.takeaway: Machine learning relies on data analysis techniques such as supervised and unsupervised learning, decision trees, neural networks, and reinforcement learning to enable computers to learn patterns and make predictions from data.
